title: Kid Fish set for Wise County Park
content: The Texas Game Wardens will hold their annual Kid Fish event as part of the Texas Parks and Wildlife’s free fishing day at Wise County Park Saturday.    Registration starts at 8 a.m. A limited number of free rods and reels will be available through the Tarrant Regional Water District. Local game wardens and fishing guides will assist kids fishing, according to Game Warden David Pellizzari.    “There’s kids that have never fished or don’t have a rod and reel. We’ll get them hooked up and fishing,” Pellizzari said.    The event runs through the day.    The free fishing day kicks off National Fishing and Boating Week. Anglers can fish any public waters in the state without a fishing license.
contentWithMarkup:
The Texas Game Wardens will hold their annual Kid Fish event as part of the Texas Parks and Wildlife’s free fishing day at Wise County Park Saturday.

Registration starts at 8 a.m. A limited number of free rods and reels will be available through the Tarrant Regional Water District. Local game wardens and fishing guides will assist kids fishing, according to Game Warden David Pellizzari.

“There’s kids that have never fished or don’t have a rod and reel. We’ll get them hooked up and fishing,” Pellizzari said.

The event runs through the day.

The free fishing day kicks off National Fishing and Boating Week. Anglers can fish any public waters in the state without a fishing license.
